meanings.sent1: The tiny seed will wroot into a beautiful flower.
meanings.sent2: Plants need sunlight and water to wroot properly.
meanings.sent3: I wonder if I can wroot a money tree in my backyard.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for music wroots deep within her soul.
meanings.sent5: The love and care you give will help the friendship wroot and blossom.

meanings.sent1: The dog loves to wroot around in the garden looking for buried treasures.
meanings.sent2: I need to wroot out the weeds from the flower bed.
meanings.sent3: It's like a treasure hunt when you wroot through old boxes in the attic.
meanings.sent4: She had to wroot out the truth from the tangled web of lies.
meanings.sent5: The detective had to wroot out the clues to solve the mystery.

meanings.definition: To cause to grow or develop
meanings.sent1: The teacher's encouragement will wroot confidence in her students.
meanings.sent2: Positive feedback can wroot a sense of achievement in children.
meanings.sent3: The magic potion was said to wroot instant hair growth.
meanings.sent4: Her words of wisdom wrooted a new perspective in my mind.
meanings.sent5: Kindness can wroot happiness in the hearts of others.
